messages.subject: Re: Fic + Vid "ShinsenCaterers"
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Chuck YES!  The Rokumeikan was in the last scenes of Lady Snowblood!  (^_^) It was scandalous on many levels to the people of the time...women dancing
messages.messageBody:
Dear Chuck
YES! The Rokumeikan was in the last scenes of Lady Snowblood! (^_^)
It was scandalous on many levels to the people of the time...women
dancing with foreigners and so forth. The newspapers had a field day
after each event. The Rokumeikan was also a feature film directed by
KON ICHIKAWA and a play written by YUKIO MISHIMA.

I highly recommend fanfic writers to look into the
Rokumeikan---history provides some pretty interesting backdrops to
stories.

::sigh:: the best part of the vid didn't survive (near the end)---I
grabbed images of waltzing folks from google, produced silhouettes and
animated them in different layers at different rates---really looked
like they were dancing.

Oh well--just 2 hrs down the drain

I would never recommend Windows movie maker to anyone who wishes to
make a music vid.


--- In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, Chuck Harris
<chuckjharris@y...> wrote:

> I do have a question about the Rokumeikan, though. Is that the setting
> for the end of Lady Snowblood?

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ_Spy_Division] Fic + Vid "ShinsenCaterers"
messages.msgSnippet: I liked this...  and I loved the image of Saitou infiltrating a fancy ball in a caterer s uniform, not to mention the inevitable mayhem to ensue. I do have a
messages.messageBody:
I liked this... and I loved the image of Saitou infiltrating a fancy
ball in a caterer's uniform, not to mention the inevitable mayhem to ensue.

I do have a question about the Rokumeikan, though. Is that the setting
for the end of Lady Snowblood? The description sounds almost exact (two
levels, wealthy Japanese in western clothes, etc.).

Arigatou,
Chuck

--
Chuck Harris "You can tame a dog with food, you can tame a
chuckjharris@... man with money, but no one can tame a wolf
Baka soku zan! of Mibu!" -- Saitou Hajime, Rurouni Kenshin
